title: X Factor Celebrity: The Chase's Jenny Ryan reveals Simon Cowell brought her back
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Chase’s Jenny Ryan has spoken out after her shock return to X Factor: Celebrity after a last minute switch-up from Simon Cowell.

The quizmaster and wannabe singer was told by Nicole Scherzinger on Saturday night she wouldn’t be making it through to the live shows after auditioning a spot in Simon’s Hollywood home.

However, just 24 hours later, it was revealed that Jenny would be appearing after all, and was given a dramatic return after viewers kicked off online, demanding her reinstation.

Speaking on This Morning, she said: ‘I had the auditions, I’d been told I wasn’t going through. Came home, cried a little bit, ate quite a lot of ice cream – which I probably shouldn’t do as it’s not very good for the throat, dairy!’

‘Then I got a phone call after what felt like the longest time, it was quite a wait, and I got a phone call from Simon inviting me to come back,’ she revealed.

As Eamonn probed about whether Simon would ever admit he was wrong about her, she laughed and coyly said: ‘Not quite! But it was inferred. I inferred it from what he said.’

Jenny beamed as she revealed Simon called her himself to ask her back (Picture: ITV)

Ruth then suggested that it was the fan reaction that caused the sudden change of heart and Jenny appeared to confirm that it was.

‘I was not expecting that level of support from the public, after my first audition last week, the flood of comments I had was overwhelming,’ The Vixen confirmed.

‘I’d spend half an hour looking at comments and had to stop because I was crying too much.’

Jenny reveals Simon had a change of heart and brought her back after fan backlash (Picture: Rex)

‘I have to say thank you to everybody who took the time, to write in and make their feelings known,’ she added.

‘Because even if I didn’t get to the live shows, or they didn’t change their mind and put me through, that wave of affection and admiration I got was enough to lift anyone.’

Jenny will now join the other hopefuls and be back on our screens this Saturday but kept secrets of what she’ll be singing a secret.

While there appeared to be no theme for what’s coming up, she teased the acts would ‘do something that shows them off and shows what they’re intending to do if they get through.’

X Factor starts Saturday at 8.20pm on ITV.
